author: Jeff Peacock
comment: Seems like a good idea, but after I bought it, it disappeared. It's not in my Android Wear or my phone desktop but it IS in my app list. I tried rebooting the phone (LG G5 connected to an LG Urbane watch) but still no luck. Help!  Update - figured it out. You to click on 'Installed' to get it going.

Lovely, aesthetic watch face. It's a tiny planisphere, although to be really useful you'd need a watch the size of a dinner plate. Instead of seconds I would like to see the rim have daylight / twilight / dark displayed, and the sun and moon's positions marked using either true solar time or local mean time. That would make it a practical astronomy tool to boot.

author: David Campbell
comment: Absolutely perfect. This has quickly become my favorite watch face, it never fails to get a good reaction from people. Attractive, functional, and simple while giving you really interesting information about the sky above you. I love this watch face, and the only improvement I would suggest is to add the ISS.

author: Kyle Crago
comment: I love this watchface. I also own ISSDetector. RunaR makes great software

author: Jacob Pickett
comment: I love it, however recently re-paired and can't get to pop up anymore :( Would like a fix :)
Please add a link to home screen and 12 hr clock

author: Ignaty Romanov-Chernigovsky
comment: I'm seeing a lot of bad reviews stating  the app isn't working on phone X,  watch Y. Well,  it's working fine on my Xperia Z3 and Smartwatch3. And it's great. Given that few watch faces actually do anything apart from changing aesthetics, this one is pretty useful. You basically get a real time map of the sky on your wrist. You can get an idea of how long you have until sunset, whether the bright dot in the sky is a star or a planet, that sort of thing. I am running out of space,  so I'll leave it at that.
title: Don't judge the app unless it's running

author: Adam Schueller
comment: Great display for space nerds! Really striking visual, my go-to face now for sheer wow-factor. The ambient mode looks great with just the stars & time. Would love to see a few enhancements: star density slider (default is a bit busy), digital display size adjustment.
title: Gorgeous display

author: Steve Tonkin
comment: Attractive face plus a decent night mode. My greatest issue with it, and the reason I cannot give it 5*, is that the sidereal time is GMST, not LST, which makes this feature functionally useless (unless you happen you live on the Greenwich meridian). It would also benefit from an optional battery meter.

author: Peter Watson
comment: Didn't show up anywhere on phone in Android wear. Life is too short so refunded.
title: Disappointing

author: David Evans
comment: As an astronomy enthusiast I really appreciate this wearable app.  A well deserved 4 stars that would be 5 if it came with a battery level display on the second screen.

author: Robert Sears
comment: I would give it 5 stars if the stars remain on during ambient mode not just the time. Also more options for the time display like font, size, color, and brightness.
title: Nice but needs more options

author: Em Lam
comment: Bought and unable to see the app on my nexus 6P or load it on my Huawei watch. Refund or fix.

author: billy thompson
comment: Utter shite none of these apps work properly. How do I get a refund

reply.author: RunaR
reply.content: After installation it can take a minute before the app appears on you're Android Wear smart watch. You can also access the watch face through the Android Wear app. Email me at support@issdetector.com for a refund.

title: Cant find it

author: John D
comment: Looked and did not see the promised stars. Refund....

reply.author: RunaR
reply.content: contact me at support@issdetector.com for the refund.

title: What rubbish is this?

author: Eighty Ace
comment: Worked perfectly for me.
title: Just Fine

comment: It is absolutely gorgeous Huawei watch

author: PA F
comment: Just love it. Thank you​ !

author: B. Hilton
comment: works perfect
title: lg urbane

comment: Cool

author: Simon Davies
comment: Loved the idea but nothing comes up when it says downloaded, uninstalled and restarted both devices to no avail.

reply.author: RunaR
reply.content: StarWatch was updated. This version should install without problems on your watch.

title: Does not work with Nexus 6P and Huawei Watch

author: Gary Leung
comment: After 2 weeks, StarWatch face show up on my Moto Sport finally. Amazing! ThankYou!

reply.author: RunaR
reply.content: Looks like a problem with Google Play Services. Go to the main device settings - Apps. Stop Google Play Services, reset data. Stop Google Play. Restart phone. Try to update Google Play Services again. Kind regards, RunaR.

author: Jeremy Rollins
comment: It was an awesome watchface when I used my old phone, but ever since I switched over to my new Moto g4 it won't show up on the watch or in the Android wear app and I've even tried all of the tips given by the dev would be 5 stars otherwise

reply.author: RunaR
reply.content: StarWatch was updated. This version should install without problems on your watch.

title: Great before

author: Nagy Bahnan
comment: After I updated my Google Play Services, I managed to use the app perfectly. Thanks to Derk.
title: I can't even find it!

author: Tai Thanh Vo
comment: Uninstalled and installed many times. Doesn't show up on watch, nor in Android wear app.

reply.author: RunaR
reply.content: StarWatch was updated. This version should install without problems on your watch.

title: Doesn't sync with moto360

comment: Does not show up anywhere on phone or watch (Samsung Galaxy S7/Samsung Gear 2).

reply.author: RunaR
reply.content: StarWatch only works on Android Wear watches. The Samsung Gear 2 runs on Tizen instead of Android. This will never work. Contact me on support@issdetector.com for a refund.

title: Nope

author: joe starr
comment: Awesome watch for a stargazer. I couldn't be happier.
title: Great watch

author: JT M
comment: I can't find it after installation in my moto 360 2gen

reply.author: RunaR
reply.content: StarWatch was updated. This version should install without problems on your watch.

author: AHMED REFFAT
comment: Poor resolution and no detail
title: Doesn't worth it

author: Tibor Zimányi
comment: Perfect

author: Thor Odinson
comment: Wish there was a way to have stars but less stars. I feel they clutter up the screen and take away from the planets. Some stars are bigger than others and look like planets. When you have everything on, the screen is super cluttered (Zenwatch2). Also, a little confused on what all I'm looking at as far as the way the planets rotate.. Think there could be some improvements. But its a pretty good face. Sucks there isn't a good square face verision
title: Needs improvement

author: Peter G.
comment: Looks awesome, there only are a few things that could be improved on imo. In digital mode, I kinda wish there was an option to have the seconds show as numbers instead of this obnoxious circle-thingy - in analog mode, a real seconds hand would be nice.  Little dots/circles around the edges (only in analog, to indicate where the hour numbers on a normal watch would be - and maybe some minute marks in between too. Then I could tell the time more precisely.) would look way better imo, especially if we had the option to choose between different styles of watch hands.  In addition, it would really be nice to be able to somehow hide the time/date so all you see is the star chart... then it would actually be usable too!  Oh, and one last thing: Having the ability to change the font to something more stylish/elegant/less casual would be great.

author: William Austin
comment: I like it so far and I will almost certainly update this review later.  I love the screen (I used to be a physicist and always secretly wanted to be an astronomer - but was always in the right place at the right time - for SOMETHING ELSE of course - and so I never got to do what I really wanted), and it looks wonderful on my Moto 360.  The single problem which I've encountered so far was in buying it and then getting to use it.  That's why I rated it 4 stars instead of 5.  I often buy things for my phone from my desktop machine and have never had this problem before, but when I bought this app from my desktop, it showed that it was installed.  But "installed where???" was the question.  It didn't show up on my phone (even after a full reboot and after sync'ing), and even going into settings and looking there the app manager list didn't locate it.    So I got a refund and then bought it from my phone directly - and Bingo, it worked.  Otherwise so far I really like it, and unless it turns out to be a battery hog (on a moto 360 that can be an issue), I'll most likely use it as my primary face.

author: Mulds Took
comment: Most watch faces look like watches, smart watches are something mew and exciting, with all of the data and options on the internet I am surprised more watch faces haven't done more with it. This face is wonderful, and totally unique that sets smart watches apart from regular watches. For that I am grateful, with quick support time, and truly a watch face worth paying for.
title: Interesting and a statment

author: Michael Sparks
comment: It shows the sky, looks cool in ambient mode, allows tweaking of settings. Sometimes I'll switch to other faces, but always seem to come back to this one. Totally worth it.
title: Really fantastic

author: Steve Marsh
comment: I like it, but compared to other faces, a little limited and for someone not familiar with star charts, not sure if it does more then just a star wallpaper. Got used to other faces that display more info, like weather and steps. Looks really busy if you turn everything on in settings so its okay.  Other people notice it and like so..
title: Neat

author: adrian simental
comment: At first i was skeptical but at the end im glad i purchased this watch face. It is stupendous, sucker for space and this will be my daily.
title: Really cool watch face!

author: Sumeet Khanna
comment: Not able to see the watch face in settings in Moto 360. Also is there an option to mark/ label bodies on watch face
title: Nice but not able to customize

author: Christopher Kuri
comment: I wish there was an option to shut off the planets and I noticed that when the watch comes on it tends to resize repeatedly. Also,  when changing the star color, it generally never changes to the color wanted, always resumes being white.
title: Cool

author: Hui Chen
comment: Im not educated enough to know for sure, but why not. Maybe a star reading tutorial would help. Looks cool.
title: I Assume It Works
